greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: a(n) = A262519(n) - A262518(n).
comment: a(n) = How many steps more are needed to reach zero when starting from k = 2*n + 1 than when starting from k = 2*n and repeatedly applying the map that replaces k by k - d(k)? [Here d(k) is the number of divisors of k (A000005)]. If it takes more steps when starting from 2n than from 2n+1, then a(n) is negative.
link: Antti Karttunen, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..10000
xref: Cf. A000005, A049820, A155043, A262518, A262519, A262521 (positions of negative values).
results.author: _Antti Karttunen_, Oct 02 2015
